B86A139FB7AA41F8BDBD063F3D5CEC19.description:
Given a data set: report the number of observations; identify
the unit of measurement; calculate mean and/or median, range, and
IQR (Interquartile Range); describe the pattern. (E)

4038E261029C462687F28C1CE5D36300.description:
Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context in
multiple ways, such as:
a. Report the number of observations;
b. Describe the nature of the attribute under
investigation, including how it was measured and its
units of measurement;
c. Determine quantitative measures of center (mean
and/or median) and spread (range and interquartile
range);
d. Describe any overall pattern and any striking deviations from
the overall pattern with reference to the context in which the
data were gathered; and
e. Relate the choice of measures of center and spread to the
shape of the data distribution and the context in which the
data were gathered. (E)

6EFAE9BB7CD14818A35A5B94E87CA0A4.description:
Formulate a statistical question. Organize data to create
line plots. (E)

009AC3FC39E8433F835F60BF48C3BD0E.description:
Formulate statistical questions; collect and organize the data
(e.g., using technology), and display and interpret the data with
graphical representations (e.g., using technology). (E)

2BCB8CEC83D74521AA1C42437C8299D5.description:
Create histograms given a data set. Use box plots to
interpret data.

FD36576DD6BD4989B28BB9DDB2DE3A23.description:
Select, create, and interpret graphical representations of
numerical data, including line plots, histograms, and box plots.

F3E464BEEB6F4814ADBC0AACAAED05C9.description:
Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional
number side lengths limited to halves when given the formula V =
lwh, a model, and all required measurements.

6391B0F301FC455DBFC7878DC4FC16ED.description:
Find the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional
edge lengths using unit cubes of the appropriate unit fraction edge
lengths (e.g., using technology or concrete materials) and show that
the volume is the same as would be found by multiplying the edge
lengths of the prism. Apply the formulas V = lwh and V = Bh to find
volumes of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths to
solve real-world and other mathematical problems. (E)

4CA547A423DA4AF681EC6F9C0C133A2A.description:
In real-world and mathematical problems, find the area of
complex shapes consisting of rectangles and triangles by composing
or decomposing into simple shapes when provided the formulas. (E)

4D2B84B97D854E939CFE935067FAFD5A.description:
Find the area of complex shapes composed of polygons by
composing or decomposing into simple shapes; apply this technique to
solve real-world and other mathematical problems.

998B5C2DD56B47C0954A5DC5D35D704A.description:
Find the unknown angle in triangles and quadrilaterals
when provided the sum of interior angles.

1680CD3F3A864D259B580FAFDCBA254C.description:
Apply the sums of interior angles of triangles and
quadrilaterals to solve real-world and mathematical problems.

3348414B694B461B9C587038B7A9EE21.description:
Convert between measurement systems (Customary to
Customary and metric to metric) given the conversion factors. (E)

0CA173EB343E4548A7FD6AFD85C065D6.description:
Convert between measurement systems (Customary to metric
and metric to Customary) given the conversion factors, and use these
conversions in solving real-world problems.

F78E1B3CEDCC4298BA046FA29A425982.description:
Plot and find the distance between points that either have
the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate on the
coordinate plane.

0088182440E34CF6856573676A156313.description:
Solve real-world and other mathematical problems by graphing
points with rational number coordinates on a coordinate plane. Include
the use of coordinates and absolute value to find distances between
points with the same first coordinate or the same second coordinate.
(E)

2596171DFD6E40B38D037A338BAF5F11.description:
Represent a real-world problem as a one-step inequality in
the form of x > c, x ≥ c, x < c, or x ≤ c, where c is a whole number. (E)

129A39E0CAD44ED1899B3229257604E3.description:
Write an inequality of the form x > c, x ≥ c, x < c, or x ≤ c,
where c is a rational number, to represent a constraint or condition in a
real-world or other mathematical problem. Explain that inequalities
have infinitely many solutions and how to represent solutions on a
number line diagram.

6B6DBDC0A43644B1B211FD1AB98A8E9B.description:
Solve real-world one-step linear equations using whole
numbers.

54BF709B0E6242FF9C4E517144F8F301.description:
Solve equations of the form x + p = q, x - p = q, px = q, and x/p
= q fluently for cases in which p, q and x are all nonnegative rational
numbers. Represent real-world problems using equations of these
forms and solve such problems. (E)

75145F88E6AB46018C8C494B2E539B5D.description:
Given a set of whole numbers, use substitution to determine
which number makes an equation or inequality true.

A2CB247AB2B341DAAB28D10A96B14E1F.description:
Demonstrate which values from a specified set, if any, make
the equation or inequality true. Use substitution to determine whether a
given number in a specified set makes an equation or inequality true.
(E)

BFF10DD877DD480E8B55300D2C048884.description:
Write one-operation single-variable expressions to
represent real-world problems and evaluate them for given values
(e.g., Miguel has a stack of cards. He added three cards to the
stack. An expression that represents how many total cards Miguel
has is x + 3). (E)

F22206867DB84FDABD4EB8B6D7B2FF11.description:
Define and use multiple variables when writing expressions to
represent real-world and other mathematical problems, and evaluate
them for given values. (E)

1C35C1DB6CA44E0DBB2AB52D754B0051.description:
Given a real-world problem and a graph or table
representing a proportional relationship, identify the independent and
dependent variables and explain the relationship between them.

7582560EC3834F51AD1C55C08A5C5916.description:
Use variables to represent two quantities in a proportional
relationship in a real-world problem; write an equation to express one
quantity, the dependent variable, in terms of the other quantity, the
independent variable. Analyze the relationship between the dependent
and independent variables using graphs and tables, and relate these
to the equation. (E)

890797A8D79F4500AE3EE0DCC054B521.description:
Solve real-world and other mathematical one-step problems
with whole number unit rates and ratios using models and various
strategies (e.g., table of equivalent ratios, double number lines, tape
diagrams, or equations).

3F8F946698B84FF598FF21799308B8D2.description:
Solve real-world and other mathematical problems involving
rates and ratios using models and strategies such as reasoning about
tables of equivalent ratios, tape diagrams, double number line
diagrams, or equations. (E)

33B38B73821F463EB3E3DFCF2470FDEC.description:
Find missing values in a table that represents a proportional
relationship. Plot provided values on a coordinate plane. (E)

768F84CE7CC1419983D0C8492E8DFC5F.description:
Make tables of equivalent ratios relating quantities with
whole-number measurements, find missing values in the tables, and
plot the pairs of values on the coordinate plane.

79F27EDD975B452AAF1FF2C51FD9EB21.description:
Understand the concept of a unit rate in the context of a
ratio relationship. (E)

C65E2A63D0724CEC9EBF502E8AEFAC10.description:
Understand the concept of a unit rate and use terms related to
rate in the context of a ratio relationship.

8D0F86AF8D3243768BD5DCD0A7ACABE2.description:
Given two numbers in different forms (decimals, fractions, or
percents) identify that numbers are equivalent. Include the use of
visual models. (E)

CFF9C475736B472BAC720B3A91978C0A.description:
Convert between any two representations (fractions, decimals,
percents) of positive rational numbers without the use of a calculator.
(E)

A7A9E5FCC35844C0B0D4EB2FCF9EE18C.description:
Understand that exponents represent repeated multiplication.
Evaluate whole numbers (0-10) using exponents (limit to an exponent
of 5). (E)

BCAE880FF5E341998C2A4E905690C4C4.description:
Evaluate positive rational numbers with whole number
exponents.

379D2E8C1361474CA126516E961210AF.description:
Identify equivalent linear expressions by using the
properties of operations.

53CC6BA668254F44B411B4DBA4D0A247.description:
Apply the properties of operations (i.e., identity, inverse,
commutative, associative, distributive properties) to create equivalent
linear expressions and to justify whether two linear expressions are
equivalent when the two expressions name the same number
regardless of which value is substituted into them. (E)

BBDCA61D88A54ADEAE6633F4FB1DCAAF.description:
Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less
than or equal to 60 and the least common multiple of two whole
numbers less than or equal to ten. Use the distributive property to
express a sum of two whole numbers from 1 to 60, with a common
factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common
factor.

CB369FF5B57F46E2B54233F1000DF7E1.description:
Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less
than or equal to 100 and the least common multiple of two whole
numbers less than or equal to 12. Use the distributive property to
express a sum of two whole numbers from 1 to 100, with a common
factor as a multiple of a sum of two whole numbers with no common
factor.

EFD0F1AFBCD64A89A82B7296B844F5D0.description:
Apply the order of operations and properties (commutative,
associative, and distributive property) to evaluate numerical
expressions with whole numbers. (E)

FDAAA31397544685A3D5DBEE8780D2E4.description:
Apply the order of operations and properties of operations
(i.e., identity, inverse, commutative properties of addition and
multiplication, associative properties of addition and multiplication, and
distributive property) to evaluate numerical expressions with
nonnegative rational numbers, including those using grouping
symbols, such as parentheses, and involving whole number
exponents. (E)

C69619F5BC944CE6AE4EF1654BD151F8.description:
Solve one-step real-world problems using decimals to the
hundredths place or fractions. For addition and subtraction, limit
denominators to 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, and 12. (E)

6960F98C4D404839A5166C212602FA69.description:
Solve real-world problems with positive fractions and decimals
by using one or two operations. (E)

B253135032CE47FEBED6AD18F8497514.description:
Use a number line to plot integers and positive fractions.
Order up to three integers and positive fractions using a model or
number line.

98499E0171C742BE8E956D94DDEC3383.description:
Compare and order rational numbers and plot them on a
number line. Write, interpret, and explain statements of order for
rational numbers in real-world contexts.

C1A98F308A2E4860BBF700A6DB0F2175.description:
Locate whole numbers and their opposites on a number
line. (E)

555D785AAFBB4FCA9EE2BE802543837F.description:
Explain how opposite signs of numbers indicate locations on
opposite sides of 0 on the number line; identify the opposite of the
opposite of a number.

2269058E629847439166F391E49424F9.description:
In a real-world context, identify if a situation represents a
positive value, a negative value, or zero. (E)

C4EC4A8A8ED24B1B9CF792E2921AD63A.description:
Use positive and negative numbers to represent and compare
quantities in real-world contexts, explaining the meaning of 0 in each
situation. (E)
